content.question: When you are asked to refer specifically to the Latin, you must: write out the Latin and/or cite line numbers AND translate, accurately paraphrase, or make clear in your discussion that you understand the Latin. "Tuque, o sanctissima vates, praescia venturi, da (non indebita posco regna meis fatis) Latio considere Teucros errantesque deos agitataque numina Troiae. (5) Tum Phoebe et Triviae1 solido de marmore templum instituam festosque dies de nomine Phoebi." 1Trivia, -ae, f.: Hecate, sometimes identified with the goddess Diana 1. Name the speaker in the passage above.

frqParts.text: When you are asked to refer specifically to the Latin, you must: write out the Latin and/or cite line numbers AND translate, accurately paraphrase, or make clear in your discussion that you understand the Latin. "Tuque, o sanctissima vates, praescia venturi, da (non indebita posco regna meis fatis) Latio considere Teucros errantesque deos agitataque numina Troiae. (5) Tum Phoebe et Triviae1 solido de marmore templum instituam festosque dies de nomine Phoebi." 1Trivia, -ae, f.: Hecate, sometimes identified with the goddess Diana 1. Name the speaker in the passage above.
2. Identify the person to whom the words sanctissima vates (line 1) refer.
3. In lines 2-6, the speaker makes both a request and a promise. What is the request and what two things are promised in return?

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
